docs.snippet: The star shortstop had a chance to tie the game in the ninth inning after a 3-0 Yankees lead evaporated, but a lineout to second base ended it....
docs.lead_paragraph: The star shortstop had a chance to tie the game in the ninth inning after a 3-0 Yankees lead evaporated, but a lineout to second base ended it.
docs.abstract: Toronto Blue Jays defeat New York Yankees, 4-3; before the game, Blue Jays present Yankees retiring shortstop Derek Jeter with all-expenses-paid trip to resort town of Banff, Alberta.

headline.main: Jays Honor Jeter in Final Visit but Treat His Team Rudely
headline.print_headline: Jays Honor Jeter in Final Visit but Treat His Team Rudely

docs.abstract: New York Mets defeat Philadelphia Phillies, 6-5.

headline.main: Wright Steps Up as Hitter and Guru to Help Mets Outlast the Phillies

docs.lead_paragraph: Baltimore’s J. J. Hardy hit the fourth grand slam of his career, and Nelson Cruz added his 35th homer, which leads the major leagues, in a victory over Minnesota.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; Baltimore Orioles shortstop J J Hardy records his fourth career grand slam in team's 12-8 victory over Minnesota Twins; other MLB scores noted.

headline.main: Grand Slam by Hardy Lifts Orioles Over Twins
headline.print_headline: Grand Slam by Hardy Lifts Orioles Over Twins

docs.snippet: A year after two attendees died from drug overdoses, the electronic music festival on Randalls Island had a host of new safety measures amid increased scrutiny....
docs.lead_paragraph: A year after two attendees died from drug overdoses, the electronic music festival on Randalls Island had a host of new safety measures amid increased scrutiny.
docs.abstract: Electric Zoo music festival attracts tens of thousands to Randalls Island over Labor Day weekend, greeted by tight security and heavy police presence; three-day event is exuberant success, with no major incidents, in stark contrast to 2013 festival's deadly drug overdoses that caused promoters to cancel final day.

headline.main: Safer Electric Zoo Festival Brings Serious Beats and Tight Security
headline.print_headline: Safer Festival Brings Serious Beats and Tight Security

docs.snippet: Joe Rice, a South Carolina alumnus who has donated about $5 million to the university’s athletic program, and other boosters could become more essential as a result of the O’Bannon ruling....
docs.lead_paragraph: Joe Rice, a South Carolina alumnus who has donated about $5 million to the university’s athletic program, and other boosters could become more essential as a result of the O’Bannon ruling.
docs.abstract: Marc Tracy On College Football column; Joe Rice, South Carolina alumnus who has donated about $5 million to university's athletic program, and other boosters could become essential following O'Bannon case ruling that players should be compensated for commercial use of their names, images and likenesses; school's athletic dept raised $36.7 million in 2013 from donations or their equivalent, out of total revenue of roughly $90 million.

headline.main: A Donor’s Passion Animates the Gamecocks’ Success
headline.print_headline: A Donor’s Passion Animates the Gamecocks’ Success

docs.snippet: Since moving to a county-run police department, Camden, N.J., one of the nation’s poorest and most dangerous cities, has altered its culture to overcome years of mistrust....
docs.lead_paragraph: Since moving to a county-run police department, Camden, N.J., one of the nation’s poorest and most dangerous cities, has altered its culture to overcome years of mistrust.
docs.abstract: Police force in Camden, NJ, beleaguered by crime, budget cuts and bad morale, has managed to change the culture of the city by restructuring at county level; Camden County Police Department, new force with more officers, tighter federal alliances and a focus on walking beats, has been prime reason for city's remarkable drop in crime, with shootings down 43 percent, and violent crime decreased by 22 percent.

headline.main: Camden Turns Around With New Police Force
headline.print_headline: Camden Turns Around With New Police Force
